channel.title: Quick question on the server running
channel.description:
So my runserver() method calls for running 'Run.bat' When I type a command that calls for resetserver() [which does call for runserver()], my players all kick, the run.bat file closes, and the server starts back up. But, my run.bat box doesn't come up. Questions being: How does that happen?!!? How do I shut the server off after the box goes away?(silly me; I could probably easily find that one out) If I close my client, will the server shut off?
I'm so dumb. Now that I right them down, I could easily answer. But I'd rather someone smarter than me answer my questions.

item.title: Quick question on the server running
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

One thread asks about my closeListener() method, and this thread asks about my server restarting. Learn the difference? Asshole.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question on the server running
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

DefaultScape.

Thanks, both of you. My server reset itself(other post explains what happens), so I’ll see what I can do with everything else.

Oh, and how would I get this box back up?

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question on the server running
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

What source are you using?

And a server will not run on any client so i would doubt if you closed your client the server would turn off, you should get a friend to see what happens when you try that method, and then you close your client. run.bat does activate your server but it might not necisarily have to be open for it to be run, but i am not sure myself.

Read full topic
